Note that Im ̸= In for m̸= n.
2.2.2 Inverse and Transpose
Deﬁnition 2.3 (Inverse). Consider a square matrix A∈Rn×n. Let matrixA square matrix
possesses the same
number of columns
and rows.
B ∈Rn×n have the property that AB = In = BA. B is called the
inverse of Aand denoted by A−1.
inverse Unfortunately , not every matrix A possesses an inverse A−1. If this
inverse does exist, A is called regular/invertible/nonsingular, otherwiseregular
invertible
nonsingular
